value: why I miss the old days here's a story
from when I was ten nine or ten years
old in grade 6 1979 ish we're in a small
town outside of Toronto Ontario where
the school is mid-sized school and
there's lots of different cultural
backgrounds involved there's it was
predominantly white but people from all
over the place where we're in this
school one day standing at the teacher's
desk about six of us waiting to get
papers looked at by her I'm right behind
this kid called Darren Muthu who was
Indian and he used to dress like John
Travolta he had on this blue polyester
suit with this huge collar and a blue
shirt underneath and he had big wavy
hair
Darren Luton he was just Darren out of
the blue on this day
Darren turns around in line so he's
facing me and he's just looking at me
with this weird look on his face it's a
kind of blank I was like what and he
reached out he grabbed me grab my chest
he grabbed me by the boobs
so imagine imagine this happens today
good lord Darren and I would have been
swept off into separate whirl winds of
shit the political vultures would have
come in and made hay with this they
would have taken us each and pitted us
against each other would probably still
the enemies we'd be scarred for life no
doubt the administration would have
gotten involved cultural stuff would
have got brought into it and it might
have been used as an example in the
media of how things are going terribly
wrong anyway all kinds of groups would
exploit this to their advantage and
Dwayne and I we would just be like wow
the world sucks what's going on but it
was 1979 so what happened was standing
in line at the teacher's desk Darren
turns around gives me a weird look grabs
him by the boobs and I punch him in the
mouth he looks stunned everybody shuts
up we all wait to see if the teachers
gonna do anything nothing happens pretty
much forgotten I think of that story
mostly because I can really picture him
in that big hair and the suit I mean it
was a shocking thing momentarily but a
federal case was not made out of it
that's my point and both of us got to
move on I don't know I mean perhaps
Aaron Loup too is is some kind of
predator now I doubt it
9 year olds 10 year olds are weird and
we work it out we push up against the
boundaries of each other and
acceptability and we lay the smackdown
on each other and it gets worked out we
grow up and I'm not saying that there
aren't real dangerous situations out
there that need intervention but when we
have we have become whole generation to
generations a whole world full of people
who think our business is the state's
business we think that they trained us
to think that and we believe it now
we've got to turn to some Authority or
something check a manual of how to deal
with every little thing it's not just
about learned helplessness it's also
about the messaging we get like we're
gonna be in trouble if we try to stand
up for herself I'm sure I would have
gotten huge trouble for taking care of
my own business there there didn't no
clock in the mouth today and it wasn't
great but it was a lot more efficient of
a solution than what we see going on now
sure this type of stuff still happens I

there that just realize hey I'm a kid
hey that guy just did something crappy
to me and they don't think automatically
they don't think oppression
that's the difference between Venna now
